com.yantra.yfc.rcp

Class YRCAction

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.yantra.yfc.rcp.YRCAction
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    org.eclipse.ui.IActionDelegate, org.eclipse.ui.IWorkbenchWindowActionDelegate
    Direct Known Subclasses:
    YRCCloseCellEditorAction, YRCExitApplicationAction, YRCHomeAction, YRCLogoutAction, YRCOpenExtnTool, YRCRefreshScreenAction, YRCRelatedTaskAction, YRCShowNavigatorViewAction, YRCShowRelatedTaskViewAction, YRCToggleRelatedTasksViewAction, YRCViewScreenModelsAction

    public abstract class YRCAction
extends java.lang.Object
implements org.eclipse.ui.IWorkbenchWindowActionDelegate
    A generic action class that can be used to delegate a specific task. This class should be used when ever a action needs to be implemented.

      • disableAction

        protected boolean disableAction()
        Method to check if the action needs to be disabled after it is executed. By default action wont be disabled. The subclass can override this method if the action needs to be disabled.
        Note: A possible use case is while calling an API. Once an API is called one not want to fire the same action again while the call is in progress. If the method is one must take care of enabling the action back when it is safe to do so.
        Returns:
        true(false) to disable(do nothing) the action.

      • checkForErrors

        protected boolean checkForErrors()
        Used to check if the editor has to be checked for errors. Return false if no check is required.
        Returns:

      • checkForModifications

        protected boolean checkForModifications()
        Used to check if the editor has to be checked for modifications. Return false if no check is required.
        Returns:

      • disableActionOnAPICall

        protected boolean disableActionOnAPICall()
        Used to check if the action has to be disabled in case a API call is made during the execute method. Return false if no check is required.
        Returns:

      • selectionChanged

        public final void selectionChanged(org.eclipse.jface.action.IAction action,
                                   org.eclipse.jface.viewers.ISelection selection)
        Notifies this action delegate that the selection in the workbench has changed.

        Implementers can use this opportunity to change the availability of the action or to modify other presentation properties.

        When the selection changes, the action enablement state is updated based on the criteria specified in the plugin.xml file. Then the delegate is notified of the selection change regardless of whether the enablement criteria in the plugin.xml file is met.

        First time, the action is registered into the action activator. Because, subsequently the registered actions can be activated / de-activated.

        Specified by:
        selectionChanged in interface org.eclipse.ui.IActionDelegate
        Parameters:
        action - the action proxy that handles presentation portion of the action
        selection - the current selection, or null if there is no selection.
